meanings.english_definition: (Latin) First-person singular present active indicative of opponō (I place against, oppose)

etymology.value: From the Latin verb 'opponō', meaning 'to place against, to oppose'. It is formed from 'ob-' (against) and 'ponō' (I place).

verb_forms.present_active_indicative: opponō, opponis, opponit, opponimus, opponitis, opponunt

usage_notes.explanation: 'Oppono' is the first-person singular present active indicative form of the Latin verb 'opponō'. It is used when the speaker is performing the action of opposing.
